comments.commentBody:
U.S. scores dead last again in healthcare study ( 2010)
U.S. scores dead last in advanced math study (2011)
U.S. scores dead last in advanced science study(2011)
U.S. scores last in women's reproductive rights (2013??*)

Even Saudi Arabia allows abortion if a mothers health is at risk.

* based on Paul Ryan saying rape is just another form of conception

More cuts to education !
More cuts to health care !
Absolute cuts to women's reproductive rights!

What a platform...
As Andy Kindler put it on Letterman last night: "Today it was the storm. The other plagues come in tomorrow."
Well, he can, and should, make those points after the fact.

It is an outcome one expects from an electoral system that equates money with political speech.  Resistance is futile...outside a constitutional amendment.  But, it is too late.  The electorate has willfully given up its rights.
Douglas was also rumored to be a (wait for it) ... "thespian!"
Very funny.  You better cut back on the Kiwi moonshine.
Even the Economist tried and came away with this gem, "The Romney Programme for Economic Recovery, Growth and Jobs” is like “Fifty Shades of Grey” without the sex."

Stevenz, it is really too bad that the Military, for some stupid reason, believes that the Republiucans will take the best care of them.  Now, they will certainly do their best to enhance the Revenue of Defense Contractors; BUT, the troops...they are mere cannon fodder.

While I understand the point you are seeking to make, having the press fully reporting on the award shows the troops & their families that the nation sees this award as important to the nation. I believe the President will know how to carry this occassion off without turning it into a political sideshow.
Let's not Micro-Manage.  That would come after a (hopefully not) Republlcan Win.  Then, your kids will go to unnecessary wars; but, his, will not.;  More Missions to France?
Mitt thinks he should have all the "free stuff" (like tax breaks) for himself.

The dissembling Bishop never mentions that as governor he requested just such a waiver.
.
He also doesn't mention he was a prep school cheerleader, just like Bush, or that he dodged the draft like Cheney, Gingrich, Limbaugh, Buchanan.
Why, then, has the Obama campaign's rebuttal to these charges been so tepid?  This feckless assertion demands a strong, no nonsense response from the President.

A Unit Citation does more than honor those who belonged to the unit during the period of service for which the Unit is being recognized. The Citation sets a standard for the members of that Unit, and for future recruits of that Unit (who become its custodian) -- a standard which they know they are bound to uphold.
Mr. Obama -- Commander-in-Chief -- show the Uniformed Services that you understand this and respect the role this Citation fills in the heritage of this Unit.
Hal Cheney (CW3, US Army Ret.)

Thanks to tax cuts and deregulation, the rich have gotten richer and used their growing wealth to take control of what is supposed to be our government.  Both parties cater to the top 1%, but the Republicans more so than the Democrats.  We, the bottom 99%, are no longer represented.  We don't matter.  We are being sacrificed so the rich can get even richer.
I am counting on and looking forward to  Mitt to Swiftboating Obama in October. Mitt's a felon and a murderer? Two can play at that game.

Agreed. The Dems are having a harder time motivating their base these days precisely because the Dems no longer represent the beliefs of most liberals. Even moderate liberals like myself find Obama and friends too far to the right on most issues.

For example, Obama signed the NDAA of 2012, which undoes basic constitutional protections of human rights and due process of law -- and even negates the essence of the Magna Carta. Obama is persecuting medical marijuana with fascist glee, despite his heavy personal use back in college. Obama pushed through a massive giveaway to the private medical insurance industry. Etc.

Liberals need a third party that's viable enough to pulls the Dems to the Left far enough to get out of historical Rep territory, just as the Tea Party dragged the Reps to the
Right. The problem is that the Tea Party was very well funded by super-rich people who obviously have a lot to gain from Rep policy directions. Who's gonna fund a left-leaning third party? Poor people?

Views of the parties are outdated:  on economic issues, the Democratic Party is now actually the conservative party-- fighting to keep things the way they are-- and the Republican Party members are radicals-- trying to radically change the understanding of the social welfare safety net built up over the last century.  On social issues, of course, the roles of the parties are reversed.  Part of the problem the Democrats have in articulating their vision is that they want to speak the language of radicals while holding the positions of conservatives.

Election or not, a sitting President has duties to perform as the chief executive and Commander-in-Chief.  And one of those duties is to support, honor, and recognize the troops fighting under his Constitutional command and for America.  I would expect no less regardless of the President's party affiliation.

What's God have to say about politics tonight?

"Leave my name out of it."

and then he added,

" Mitt Romney lies a lot."
Size doesn't matter. Facts don't matter to a large number of people either as is personified in (mostly republican) voter rolls.
What is Obama's reply? Nothing.

A good example of what is wrong with our political system today. Lies and more lies are fed to the American people. A few media outlets are doing some fact checks when politicians twist the truth. Clearly much more needs to be done.

On the other hand how can the news media be objective when super packs are shelling out millions on TV ads laden with lies? The very same media that should be the bastion of democracy are being paid to spread lies. We are living dangerous times

At least the "Left in General" you mention is grounded in some sort of humanity. Many republican icons, sadly now all in the past, thought that a safety net for the American people was an important thing. They viewed it as necessary for America to succeed, you know "WE THE PEOPLE", we're in this together we help rather than hinder. The republican party seems to think that just giving the people, especially those in need, the bare minimum to survive is fine. It's hard to justify that line of thinking when the nation has nearly 30% of the population living just near or in poverty; maybe those people are all lazy. It's especially infuriating when those on the right, who want to cut social programs to the bone, are all from wealthy families who could always easily afford all the luxuries like an education, medical care fair pay and retirement. That sort of blindness to the inequities in the system that make all the difference in the world for one's prosperity are just not in the partys'  field of view. The republican party Presidential ticket is the embodiment of that indifference. Social programs work well in many place of the world but America tolerates levels of poverty and uncertainty that are more step with third world countries.

All of us pay taxes for those entitlements, schools, roads, a safety net when disaster hits, health care in old age.

Do you never use a public road? Fly into an airport? Did you pay for your own schooling from kindergarten on?

Would you call the police or fire department if something happened to your home?

So are you saying that we should return to the days before Social Security and Medicare?

As for "cradle to grave 'entitlements,'" perhaps you don't know that, according to the nonpartisan Kaiser Family Foundation, 7 of 10 nursing home residents are on Medicaid, in large part because even middle-class patients often run through their savings while in a nursing home and turn to the entitlement program.

Why would you want to condemn poor children and the elderly to illness and hunger?

Let's not be naive here, you know darn well Obama's  (and the Left in General) base is people who favor a big government apparatus, especially one that gives cradle to grave entitlements. Once you have them hooked they will vote along party lines permanently, at least that's the thought and that 's been a goal of the left for decades.
Too stupid, ignorant or lazy to fact check, the result is still the same.

Did you catch Virginia Gov. McDonnell fast-talking his way with lie after lie when Judy Woodruff (on PBS) asked him about the Romney welfare ad tonight?
What gets me is that McDonnell seems to think that voters are too stupid to fact check. He wouldn't back down, even when Ms Woodruff said the PolitiFact and Factcheck.org said the claims were wrong.
In a perfect world, those four Pinocchios awarded to the ad by the Washington Post fact checker would grow on the faces of every public official who repeats those outright lies.

This is the POTUS who ended the practice of pretended Dover did not exist - he honored the dead and the cost of war by going to Dover.

We would expect him to honor the recipients of a Presidential Unit Citation equally, and to do so with class; no ' mission accomplished ' banners in evidence anywhere.
